text: I want to assure the people of Benue, and all Nigerians, that we will ensure that the assailants are apprehended and brought to justice for this vile and sacrilegious act.
author: MBuhari

text: This latest assault on innocent persons is particularly despicable. Violating a place of worship, killing priests and worshippers is not only vile, evil and satanic, it is clearly calculated to stoke up religious conflict and plunge our communities into endless bloodletting.
author: MBuhari

text: I extend my sincere condolences to the Govt and people of Benue State, the Mbalom community, and especially the Bishop, priests & members of the St Ignatius' Catholic Church, whose premises was the unfortunate venue of the heinous killings of worshippers & two priests by gunmen.
author: MBuhari

text: This week I met with a group of young Nigerians living in the UK. We had a long discussion about Nigeria: the opportunities wasted by a Party that failed to use the resources of the country for the good of its people, and how my administration is now correcting those failings.
author: MBuhari

text: As long as I remain the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria the Chibok girls will NEVER be forgotten. Everything possible will be done to have them reunited with their families.
author: MBuhari

text: Don't imagine for a moment that we have forgotten about our daughters or that we consider their freedom a lost cause. Not on my watch!
author: MBuhari

text: We are however not relenting. We will continue to persist, and the parents should please not give up. Don't give up hope of seeing our daughters back home again. Don't lose faith in our ability to fulfill our promise of reuniting you with our daughters.
author: MBuhari

text: We know that this is not the news parents want to hear after four years of waiting, but we want to be as honest as possible with you.
author: MBuhari

text: Unfortunately, the negotiations between the government and Boko Haram suffered some unexpected setbacks, owing mainly to a lack of agreement among their abductors, whose internal differences have led to a divergence of voices regarding the outcome of the talks.
author: MBuhari

text: My administration remains focused and determined to see that the remaining #ChibokGirls and Leah Sharibu return safely to their homes and their families. Rest assured that we are doing our very best to free the girls from their captors.
author: MBuhari

text: I appeal to the parents to keep their hopes alive regarding the return of their daughters. The recent safe return of more than 100 of the #DapchiGirls, following the determined efforts of the Federal Government, should give all of us confidence that all hope is not lost.
author: MBuhari

text: As we commemorate the 4th anniversary of the abduction of the #ChibokGirls tomorrow, April 14, let me again assure the parents and families that their daughters will never be forgotten or abandoned to their fate.
author: MBuhari

text: I received a visit from the Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby and the Secretary General Worldwide of Anglican Communion, and former Archbishop of Kaduna, Josiah Idowu-Fearon. Our High Commissioner to the UK, Rtd Justice George Oguntade was also present.
author: MBuhari

text:
I am delighted to join our Christian brothers and sisters to commemorate this year’s Easter celebration. May it bring us renewed hope and confidence as a great nation. 

My 2018 Easter Message to the Nation: 

https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2117674885179367 …
author: MBuhari

text: My heart goes out to Leah’s parents, who must watch other parents rejoice while their own daughter remains in captivity. It is my responsibility, under the Constitution of Nigeria, to protect all Nigerians—and I will always strive to do that. Leah will not be abandoned.
author: MBuhari

text: It is disheartening that one of the girls, Leah Sharibu, remains in captivity. Let me assure that I am as committed to her freedom as I was to the girls’ freedom when all 110 of them were in captivity. We will do everything in our power to bring Leah back safely.
author: MBuhari

text: I received the news of the return of our Dapchi daughters with great joy. And I look forward to receiving them at the State House. I thank everyone who was involved in the negotiations for their return.
author: MBuhari

text: We are therefore widening and deepening domestic consultations on the CFTA, to ensure that all concerns are respectfully addressed. Any African Free trade agreement must Fairly and Equitably represent the interest of Nigeria, and indeed, her African brothers and sisters.
author: MBuhari

text: As Africa’s largest economy and most populous country, we are committed to ensuring that all trade agreements we sign are beneficial to the long-term prosperity of the continent.
author: MBuhari

text: Nigeria fully recognizes & appreciates the efforts of the African Union Commission so far, regarding the implementation of a sustainable Continental Free Trade Agreement(CFTA) for Africa. We also acknowledge that our continental aspirations must complement our national interests.
author: MBuhari

text: The Food Security Council will bring together the Federal Government, State Governors - who will be represented by 6 Governors from across party and regional lines (Kebbi, Lagos, Ebonyi, Delta, Taraba and Plateau), Security Agencies, and key players in our agriculture sector.
author: MBuhari

text: Next week I will inaugurate a Food Security Council, which I will personally Chair, and which will work closely with the private sector to ensure alignment of all related policies, as well as bring greater efficiency to our farming, fisheries and livestock production.
author: MBuhari

text: I would like to specially thank all who have played a part in the success we’re witnessing: Ministers, State Governors, the CBN - managers of our Anchor Borrowers Program, and very importantly the investors and millers. We must continue to collaborate for even greater success.
author: MBuhari

text: The numbers so far have been impressive: investments of more than 300 billion Naira — a significant part of this invested during the recession; and largely in rural areas, building mills, creating jobs, empowering our rural areas. But there is still a lot more to be done.
author: MBuhari

text: Last week in Abuja I met with stakeholders in the rice sector: investors, farmers, processors and dealers. I am extremely pleased by the impact they’re making in our rural economy; some of the most remote and hitherto forgotten parts of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: We have the fertile land, we have water, we have the manpower, to feed ourselves. We also have the political will. And we all know that when Nigerians are committed to executing a task, it gets done; when we all come together with the same vision, Nigeria must surely win.
author: MBuhari

text: Our agriculture vision continues to be for a country that grows what it eats; one in which everyone—especially our youth—sees Agriculture as a financially viable sector; a country that supports farmers; and that promotes programs that will open up and invest in our rural areas.
author: MBuhari

text: As I noted a few days ago at a Meeting with key players in Rice in Nigeria, since 2015, @ProfOsinbajo and I have commissioned several agricultural projects and programs, across the country—From rice to wheat to cashew to animal feed to fertiliser, drinks processing and many more.
author: MBuhari

text: I commissioned the Sunti Golden Sugar Estates in Niger State today. We’re grateful to all investors who continued to invest even during the recession, demonstrating great confidence in our policies. We will continue to support the private sector to create jobs and prosperity.
author: MBuhari

text: Once again I sympathize with the people of Benue State, and the families of all those who‘ve lost their lives in these attacks. The security agencies will continue to work to protect all Nigerians. And we will not allow anyone who takes the life of a Nigerian to evade justice.
author: MBuhari

text: There are more than 250 ethnic groups in Nigeria, with different cultures and beliefs. God has put us together for a reason, and we can live peacefully together. On our part as Government I assure that we will diligently fulfill our duty of security and law enforcement.
author: MBuhari

text: I will not be President forever, Governor Ortom will not be Governor forever. Long after our service, farmers and herdsmen in Benue and elsewhere in Nigeria will still exist and will live and work side-by-side. It is our hope that this co-existence will always be a peaceful one.
author: MBuhari

text:
My message to the people of Benue today, during my visit: We are doing everything possible to end the recurring attacks by armed herdsmen in various parts of Nigeria. 
I also appealed to them to please give the security agencies a chance to deal with the situation decisively.
author: MBuhari

text: Happy 61st Birthday, @ProfOsinbajo. Thank you for being a loyal and dependable partner on this journey. I join millions of your friends and well-wishers around the world to wish you many more years of service to God, to Nigeria, and to humanity.
author: MBuhari

text:
My Speech at the 61st Independence Anniversary of the Republic of Ghana, today in Accra. I echoed the words of Kwame Nkrumah: “Those who would judge us merely by the heights we have achieved would do well to remember the depths from which we started.”
https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2103688503244672 …
author: MBuhari

text: In addition to law enforcement, we are also working with vulnerable local communities and their leaders. My message in Jalingo yesterday was that the Federal Government will support traditional institutions to fulfill their important roles as agents of peace and security.
author: MBuhari

text: Our security agencies have made progress in terms of arrests in many of the areas that have witnessed these regrettable acts of violence. We have increased deployment of personnel and resources, and the fight against illegal and unauthorized weapons has been stepped up.
author: MBuhari

text: I will be visiting Benue, Yobe, Zamfara and Rivers as well. All have witnessed unimaginable acts of violence since this year. I deeply sympathize with all who’ve lost family and loved ones. We are taking this issue very seriously, through law enforcement and peacebuilding.
author: MBuhari

text: Yesterday in Jalingo, Taraba State, I met with traditional rulers, community leaders, and representatives of farmers & herdsmen. It was also an opportunity to once again express my condolences to all those affected by violence, and to assure the State of my commitment to security
author: MBuhari

text: Boko Haram's recent cowardly attacks have only renewed the determination of our government to bring the insurgency to a decisive end, in the shortest possible time. I sympathize with the United Nations and other humanitarian agencies working in Rann, Borno State.
author: MBuhari

text:
Unlike under previous Governments where trucks conveying fertiliser would miraculously disappear in transit, in 2017, none of the three thousand, three hundred and thirty three (3,333) trucks that participated in the PFI went missing.
https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2101371503476372 …
author: MBuhari

text: Let me thank the Governor of Jigawa State & Chair of the PFI Implementation Committee; members of the Fertiliser Producers & Suppliers Association of Nigeria (FEPSAN), the Nigerian Sovereign Investment Authority (NSIA), and the 3 banks that answered the invitation to participate.
author: MBuhari

text: 15 months ago a Meeting I held with His Majesty King Mohammed VI of Morocco formally birthed the Presidential Fertilizer Initiative (PFI). Today in Abuja we reviewed the progress. I thank everyone who has worked tirelessly to make the programme a success https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2101371503476372 …
author: MBuhari

text:
They told me that they had given up all hope of ever coming back alive. I assured them that we will never give up on any of our citizens. 
I have asked the security agencies to ensure that every abducted person—including the Dapchi girls—is safely released.
author: MBuhari

text: There were the University of Maiduguri lecturers, abducted while on service to their fatherland, and also the women abducted from a funeral procession. Today they are safely back home, and Nigeria rejoices with them and with their families.
author: MBuhari

text: I can't fully express the joy I felt I this afternoon, as I received our citizens recently released from Boko Haram captivity—fathers, mothers, sons, daughters. We will go to any length to ensure that no one is left behind in the hands of terrorists. Every Nigerian life matters!
author: MBuhari

text: The military has since been deployed in response, and we are now sending more troops and surveillance aircraft to keep an eye on all movements in the entire territory on a 24-hour basis.
author: MBuhari

text: The entire country stands as one with the families, and with the government and people of Yobe State. This is a national disaster. We are sorry that it happened; we share your pain. Let me assure that our gallant armed forces will locate and safely return all the missing girls.
author: MBuhari

text: I want the families of the girls yet unaccounted for at the Government Girls Technical College, Dapchi to know that no effort will be spared to ensure that all of them are returned safely, and the attackers arrested and made to face justice.
author: MBuhari

text: I share the anguish of all the parents and guardians of the girls that remain unaccounted for. I would like to assure them that we are doing all in our power to ensure the safe return of all the girls.
author: MBuhari

text: I have directed the Military and Police to mobilize immediately to ensure that all the missing girls of Government Girls Secondary School, Dapchi, are found. The Minister of Defence will also lead a Federal Government delegation to Yobe tomorrow, to ascertain the situation.
author: MBuhari

text: The perpetrators of all of these senseless attacks on innocent and defenceless Nigerians, in all parts of the country, will be made to face the full wrath of the law. We must and will bring the spilling of innocent blood to an end. May the souls of the dead Rest In Peace.
author: MBuhari

text: I have directed the Minister of Defence to proceed immediately to Zamfara State to undertake an on-the-spot assessment of the situation there. My deepest condolences to the families of the victims of the Birane Village massacre, and the Government and people of Zamfara.
author: MBuhari

text: I salute the leadership and statesmanship of former President Jacob Zuma, and wish him the best in his future endeavours.
author: MBuhari

text: Congratulations also to the African National Congress (ANC), and the Government and people of South Africa, on the peaceful transfer of power that resulted in the election of President Ramaphosa.
author: MBuhari

text: Congratulations to @CyrilRamaphosa on his election today as the President of the Republic of South Africa. I look forward to working with him, and to the continuing cooperation of the Governments of Africa’s two leading economies.
author: MBuhari

text: Today in Kaduna I attended the induction of @NigAirForce's ‘TSAIGUMI’, Nigeria’s first indigenously-developed Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV). It is most gratifying that the Air Force has gone a step further than simply acquiring UAVs, to locally developing them.
author: MBuhari

text: Part of our success story in the Northeast is that Boko Haram is finding it more difficult to recruit people. The Nigerian Army is intensifying its onslaught; I am confident that we will soon achieve our goal of dismembering the group and rendering it completely powerless.
author: MBuhari

text: Let me also assure that all persons arrested so far, including those arrested for illegally possessing arms, will be duly prosecuted. I urge judicial officers to be alive to responsibilities in this regard, to enable the speedy dispensation of justice.
author: MBuhari

text: Our law enforcement agencies must at all times stay ahead of bandits and criminals, wherever they are across the country, by efficiently gathering, sharing and acting on credible Intelligence. I am assuring that we will give them all the support needed to succeed.
author: MBuhari

text: One of the resolutions from our Security Meeting today is that all our law enforcement agencies must take intelligence-gathering and sharing much more seriously. The Police and DSS especially have been charged to step up their efforts and capacity in this regard.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I presided over a Meeting of the Security Council. We fully understand the seriousness & urgency of Nigeria's security issues, and are determined to implement carefully considered solutions that will not only earn the confidence of Nigerians, but also stand the test of time
author: MBuhari

text: I am very pleased by this. I commend all those who made it possible, especially the International Committee of the Red Cross, ICRC, for facilitating the negotiations. I have asked the DSS and @HQNigerianArmy to intensify efforts to bring home our remaining Chibok Girls.
author: MBuhari

text: I'm extending my best wishes to #TeamNigeria as they proudly step out in Nigerian colours at the Winter Olympics in South Korea. Congratulations to Seun Adigun, Ngozi Onwumere, Akuoma Omeoga  and Simidele Adeagbo, who are all making history for themselves and for Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: We will continue to work closely with all stakeholders—State Governments, local communities, farmers, pastoralists, civil society and others—and to support initiatives to ensure peace and stability in restive areas.
author: MBuhari

text: Questions and false insinuations have also come up regarding the Ranching solution proposed by Federal the Government. Let me state very clearly that the policy— conceived after wide consultations with stakeholders—is not meant to colonize any part of the country.
author: MBuhari

text: I would like Nigerians to look at what we have accomplished so far in the Northeast, when you compare what the condition was before we came in and what it is now. We are bringing that same determination and political will to all of Nigeria's other security challenges.
author: MBuhari

text: At every step, I have tried to foresee these security problems, counting on my experience as a former military officer who commanded three out of the four divisions of the Nigerian army, in Lagos, Ibadan and Jos. We will surely make progress, and end the bloodshed.
author: MBuhari

text: It is quite frankly dishonest and unfair to insinuate that I am sitting doing nothing, while these killings are going on. Nothing could be further from the truth. I have and will continue to act in line with my responsibility as President to ensure security of lives and property.
author: MBuhari

text: The security agencies have standing instructions to arrest and prosecute any and all persons found with illegal arms. In addition, quite a number of arrests have been made so far, in relation to the killings, and all these persons will be duly prosecuted.
author: MBuhari

text: The recent killings in Benue, Adamawa, Taraba, and Zamfara states are all regrettable, and saddening. But even more importantly, I am very much aware of all the issues at stake, and doing my best to ensure that justice is done and the security of lives and property guaranteed.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I met with the Catholic Bishops Conference of Nigeria (CBCN), led by Archbishop Ignatius Kaigama. It was a welcome opportunity for me to explain in detail what we're doing as a Government to bring permanent resolution to herdsmen-farmers conflicts & violence across Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: I have repeatedly emphasized my vision for a Nigeria that produces what it consumes. To attain that vision, it is vital that local companies get preference in planning, designing and executing Sci, Tech & Eng. projects. The EO I signed today is an important step in that journey.
author: MBuhari

text: By this Order, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the Constitution, all procuring authorities shall give preference to Nigerian companies and firms in the award of contracts, in line with the Public Procurement Act of 2007.
author: MBuhari

text: I wrote to the President of the Senate, outlining the several actions we have taken in response to the killings in Benue State. Let me again assure all Nigerians of my commitment to ensuring that justice is done and that Nigerians are kept safe and secure—https://statehouse.gov.ng/news/press-release-president-buharis-letter-to-senate-president-on-benue-killings/ …
author: MBuhari

text: Congratulations to the home-based Super Eagles on their CHAN semi-final victory over Sudan tonight. Millions of Nigerians are rejoicing with you tonight, and eagerly looking forward to the final on Sunday. We are proud of you!
author: MBuhari

text: We must push ahead to speedily establish the Continental Free Trade Area (CFTA), which will make Africa more integrated, united & prosperous. As one of the principal architects of the African Union, Nigeria will show leadership and direction in this regard—https://statehouse.gov.ng/news/press-release-africa-must-speedily-establish-a-single-market-to-create-more-jobs-and-reduce-poverty-says-president-buhari/ …
author: MBuhari

text: On behalf of the Govt of Nigeria, and on my own behalf, I thank the @_AfricanUnion for entrusting me with the responsibility of serving as Champion of this year's theme: "Winning the fight against Corruption: A Sustainable Path to Africa’s Transformation." https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2082467755366747 …
author: MBuhari

text: With former President Olusegun Obasanjo and former Head of State Abdulsalami Abubakar at the AU Summit in Addis Ababa, today. #30thAUSummit
author: MBuhari

text: We will not repeat the mistakes of the past, when as a country we failed to fully utilize rising oil prices to develop our infrastructure. Our administration's pledge to you is that we will make every Naira count, for the development of Nigeria. #TheYearOfInfrastructure
author: MBuhari

text: I want to assure Nigerians that every additional income that comes to the Federal Government in 2018, from the rising price of crude oil, will be deployed to infrastructure projects: roads, rail, and power, for the benefit of all our people. #TheYearOfInfrastructure
author: MBuhari

text: Yesterday I chaired a National Security Council Meeting. We are stepping up our efforts to tackle the proliferation of small arms and light weapons across the country. The security agencies already have standing instructions to arrest and prosecute anyone found with illegal arms.
author: MBuhari

text: Pleased to welcome Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu and Chief Bisi Akande to the State House this afternoon.
author: MBuhari

text: On the economy I'm pleased with the progress we're making, the stable Naira, falling inflation, rising external reserves, rising harvests, an improving business environment as demonstrated by our rise in the World Bank's Doing Business Index, and growing manufacturer confidence.
author: MBuhari

text: Security will also continue to be a priority. We have increased the deployment of security forces, to halt the attacks by herdsmen on communities, and bring to an end the sorrow and hardships that vulnerable communities have had to endure.
author: MBuhari

text: Our focus in 2018 is infrastructure: roads, our railway projects, power, and airport concessions. We will intensify our efforts, and you will see progress. In this regard we are very grateful for what the Chinese are doing to support us, in financial and technical ways.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I received APC Leaders from the southeast. I thanked them for  consistently standing by me and supporting our administration. Even at the risk of abuse they stand firm and try to explain our vision. I'm very grateful for their efforts and sacrifices. I will never forget.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I welcomed the President of The Gambia, @BarrowPresident, to the Presidential Villa. I'm delighted that Nigeria was able to offer support during a very critical period. I look forward to continuing collaboration between our two countries.
author: MBuhari

text: I have just finished a meeting with stakeholders from Benue State. My message to them: I will fully keep the oath I swore to protect all Nigerians. The Police, Army and DSS are working hard to keep Benue safe, and to bring all the perpetrators of the killings to justice.
author: MBuhari

text: Today we honour the memory of our veterans, who paid the supreme sacrifice to keep Nigeria secure, united and at peace. I salute their gallantry and selflessness. Their labour on our behalf will never be forgotten. #ArmedForcesRemembranceDay
author: MBuhari

text:
Our security efforts in Benue State so far. Let me reassure all Nigerians that security of life and property continues to be top of our agenda, in line with our election pledge and promises: 

https://statehouse.gov.ng/news/factsheet-federal-response-to-the-attacks-and-killings-by-herdsmen-in-benue-and-other-states/ …
author: MBuhari

text: Let me specially thank @Michael_CXT, whose submission inspired the final design of my 2017 Season's Greetings Card. He won the open competition @NGRPresident organized to design the Card. I congratulate him, and wish him the best in his future endeavors.
author: MBuhari

text: I just met with the Governor of Benue State. I assured Governor Ortom of our total commitment to the security of lives & property in Benue and elsewhere. We have deployed additional security resources to fish out the attackers, bring them to justice, and prevent further attacks.
author: MBuhari

text: Our Customs and Ports officials must now make the Kaduna Inland Dry Port work. They must not frustrate business, commercial and industrial enterprises with unnecessary bureaucracy and delays. Our 'ease of doing business' attitude must be visible; we must make this Port work.
author: MBuhari

text:
I congratulate the Kaduna State Govt, Ministry of Transportation, and Nigerian Shippers’ Council.
And let me specially commend the initiative of the Shippers’ Council, & the Kaduna Govt for facilitating the establishment of the Port by providing access roads and other utilities.
author: MBuhari

text: Today is a landmark day for our importers and exporters. The Kaduna Inland Dry Port is the first proper Inland Dry Port to be completed among the seven approved across the country. Six others — in Ibadan, Aba, Kano, Jos, Funtua and Maiduguri — are at various stages of completion.
author: MBuhari

text: Today in Kaduna I'm pleased to commission 2 additional locomotives & 10 additional Passenger coaches for the Abuja-Kaduna Rail service; and to commission the new Inland Container Depot. Nigeria's infrastructure is being steadily upgraded, & our economy is set for jobs and growth.
author: MBuhari

text: As I promised in my New Year's Day Address, we're stepping up our interventions not only to combat crime and violence nationwide, but also to ensure that culprits are swiftly and severely punished. My condolences to the Govt and people of Benue, and the families of the victims.
author: MBuhari

text: One of our pledges to Nigerians is that we will ensure the safety and security of lives everywhere in the country.We will keep this promise. Let me assure that security agencies are working to arrest those behind the regrettable attack in Benue State, and prevent further attacks.
author: MBuhari

text: I appeal to the communities affected not to embark on reprisal attacks, but allow the security agencies to carry out comprehensive investigations so that the culprits can be identified and properly punished.
author: MBuhari

text: I received with dismay the reports of killings in Omoku, Rivers State and in Sango LGA of Kaduna State. This violence is unacceptable. Let me assure that security agencies are working to speedily bring the perpetrators to justice. May God comfort the families of the victims.
author: MBuhari

text:
Good morning. And I wish everyone a Happy New Year.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Finally let me again express my heartfelt thanks to all Nigerians who prayed for me during my illness last year. I feel deeply humbled by your prayers and good wishes and I am more determined than ever to serve you to the best of my ability. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
I am grateful to all the Governors and other Political & Community leaders of the Niger Delta States for their part in bringing relative peace to the areas.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: With respect to the Niger Delta, Government is still engaging responsible leadership of the Communities to help in identifying and addressing genuine grievances of the region. Our clean-up programme in collaboration with the @UN is making satisfactory progress. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: With regard to rampant cases of kidnappings, we are taking immediate short-term measures to combat this new evil creeping into our societies. Tighter police methods and swift and severe punishment for those proved to be engaged in kidnapping are on the way. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Terrorism and urban crimes are world-wide phenomena and our security forces are continuously adapting their responses to changing threats.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: On behalf of all Nigerians let me offer our thanks to the Armed forces, the Police, other para-military forces and traditional authorities who are working round the clock to ensure that you and I go about our normal business in reasonable safety. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Our government remains determined to protect all Nigerians in line with our election pledge and promises. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We have since beaten Boko Haram. Isolated attacks still occur, but even the best-policed countries cannot prevent determined criminals from committing terrible acts of terror as we have seen during the past years in Europe, Asia, Middle East, elsewhere in Africa and in America.
author: MBuhari

text: Before I conclude my address I must reassure my fellow citizens that security of life and property is still top of our government’s agenda. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
We should draw encouragement from the series of bye-elections conducted by @inecnigeria last year which were generally violence-free and their outcomes adjudged to be free and fair.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Political discourse should be conducted with civility, decorum and in a constitutional manner. We all have a collective responsibility to strengthen our democracy and entrench the rule of law. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
In this respect the rest of Nigeria could learn from the South Western States who have successfully internalized religion, ethnicity and politics.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
As the electioneering season approaches politicians must avoid exploiting ethnicity and religion by linking ethnicity with religion and religion with politics. Such must be avoided at all costs if we are to live in harmony.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
I assure you that government is ever receptive to ideas which will improve governance and contribute to the country's peace and stability.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: However, there is a strong case for a closer look at the cost of government and for the public services long used to extravagance, waste and corruption to change for the better. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
We must give a long period of trial and improvement before the system we have adopted is anywhere near fit for purpose.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We tried the Parliamentary system: we jettisoned it. Now there are shrill cries for a return to the Parliamentary structure. In older democracies these systems took centuries to evolve so we cannot expect a copied system to neatly fit our purposes. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We Nigerians can be very impatient & want to improve our conditions faster than may be possible considering our resources and capabilities. When all the aggregates of nationwide opinions are considered, my firm view is that our problems are more to do with process than structure.
author: MBuhari

text: No human law or edifice is perfect. Whatever structure we develop must periodically be perfected according to changing circumstances and the country's socio-economic developments. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: In respect of political developments, I have kept a close watch on the on-going debate about "Restructuring". #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Great nations are built by enterprising people who turn their hands to anything that circumstances dictate.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: By the same token, I am today appealing to enterprising Nigerians with ideas and unemployed graduates and other able-bodied and literate men and women with ideas to not just sit and wait for employment from the government or the Organized Private Sector. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Rice imports will stop this year. Local rice, fresher and more nutritious, will be on our dishes from now on. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Two years ago I appealed to people to go back to the land. I am highly gratified that agriculture has picked up, contributing to the government's effort to re-structure the economy. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We have got to get used to discipline and direction in economic management. The days of business as usual are numbered. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Diversification efforts have resulted in improved output particularly in agriculture and solid minerals sectors. The relative exchange rate stability has improved manufacturing sector performance.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The government is slowly stabilizing the economy. 
It was in order to change the steady and steep decline that we adopted the more sustainable policies and programmes captured in the Economic Recovery Plan. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
You will recall that it was not until last year that we got out of the economic recession into which the country had fallen as a consequence of past unsustainable economic policies which projected short-term illusory growth. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
These massive public works should spearhead the recovery and lead millions back to employment. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
This Administration is working with the privatised distribution Companies to overcome the continuing challenges of distribution.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: TCN and the Niger Delta Holding Co have added 1,950MVA of 330 down to 132KV transformer capacity of 10 transmission stations & 2,930MVA of 132 down to 33KV transformer capacity of 42 sub-stations including Ikot Ekpene, Aba, Alagbon, Ajah, Ejigbo, Funtua & Zaria. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
As I mentioned earlier, the Transmission Company of Nigeria can now distribute all the 7,000MW that can be generated.  
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
... with a financing commitment from the government of China.  Completion is targeted for 2023.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The Mambilla Hydroelectric Power Project is at last taking off. This project has been on the drawing Board for 40 years, but now the engineering, procurement and construction contract for the 3,050MW project has been agreed with a Chinese joint venture Company 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The transmission and other requirements to operate the 30MW Gurara Phase 1 Hydroelectric Plant, the 40MW Kashimbilla Hydroelectric Plant and the 215 MW Kaduna Gas/LPG/Diesel Power Plant will also be completed this year.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The Zungeru 700MW Hydroelectric Power Project, stalled by court cases is due for completion in 2019.  
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Katsina Power Project is now being tested and producing 10MW of power from wind for the first time in Nigeria. It should be fully operational this year. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Several moribund projects have been revived. Repairs of Afam Power Station added 110MW in 2017 and another 240MW will be added this year through a private investment partnership.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Consequently, generation has now reached 7,000MW. On December 8, 2017 the country achieved 5,155MW of power delivered to consumers, the highest level ever recorded. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The Payment Assurance Guarantee Scheme which started in January 2017 has enabled the Nigerian Bulk Electricity Trader to raise so far N701 billion to assure Generation Companies of at least 80% payment for any power delivered to the national grid.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: More Nigerians across the country are experiencing improved power supply to their homes and businesses. However, power remains a concern to this government because too many people still do not have regular and reliable supply. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
In addition, Government has approved work to start on the re-construction of Abuja – Kaduna – Zaria – Kano road which is in a state of disrepair. Work will soon start and is expected to be completed in 2019.

#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
f.    Kaduna Eastern Bypass,

g.  Dualization of Kano – Maiduguri Road,

h.  Dualization of Abuja – Lokoja – Benin Road,

i.    Dualization of Suleja – Minna Road.

 #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The following major highways are to receive special attention:

a.  Oyo – Ogbomosho,

b.  Ofusu – Ore – Ajebandele – Shagamu,

c.  Yenagoa Road Junction – Kolo Otuoke – Bayelsa Palm,

d.  Enugu – Port Harcourt Dual Carriage Way,

e.  Onitsha – Enugu Expressway,

#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Government is undertaking repairs and maintenance of 44 roads within the six geo-political zones. 

Twenty-five major highways will be funded under the N100b SUKUK facility. Each geo-political zone will benefit by an equal amount of N16.67b. 

#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: The Management of the Federal Road Maintenance Agency (FERMA) has been reconstituted and has been charged with a 12-week rapid intervention in road repairs to cover all the geo-political zones. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: 12 railway stations around the capital over a 45.2km route will serve as a catalyst and a pull factor to the economy of the area. The Light Rail System will reduce traffic congestion and carbon emission in line with the Administration’s policy on climate change. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
This train service will stimulate economic activities in the Federal Capital and provide residents with an efficient and safe transportation system. 
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
With respect to the Abuja Light Rail, progress has reached 98% completion, as at 64% completion when we assumed office. Only test runs remain before start of operations.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: In the next few years, all these Nigerian cities will be linked by functional modern rail systems, giving enormous boost to the social and economic life of our people. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Secondly, the Lagos to Calabar "Coastal Rail", through Ore, Benin, Agbor, Asaba, Onitsha, Sapele, Ughelli, Warri, Yenagoa, Otuoke, Port Harcourt, Aba, Uyo and Calabar.  
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Negotiations are also advanced for the construction of other railway lines, firstly from Kano to Maradi in Niger Republic passing through Kazaure, Daura, Katsina, Jibiato Maradi.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: The Abuja to Itakpe line will go through Baro and terminate in Warri, with construction of a new seaport at Warri. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: At the same time I have approved and negotiations will be concluded in the first part of this year for the Port Harcourt to Maiduguri line covering Aba, Owerri, Umuahia, Enugu, Awka, Abakaliki, Makurdi, Lafia, Jos, Bauchi, Gombe, Yola and Damaturu. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: The Abuja – Kaduna route will be boosted by additional rolling stock next Thursday and will be able to handle one million commuters annually. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Construction of the Kano – Kaduna segment is expected to commence this year and reach Kaduna by the end of 2019. By the end of 2021 the two ends will be joined so that we will have standard gauge railway across the main North-South trading route. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
The line should reach Ibadan from Lagos by the end of this year and will carry two million passengers per year and five million tons of cargo will be transported every year giving a substantial boost to the country’s economy.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
With regards to Railways, we have set ourselves ambitious targets. Already in construction stage is the Lagos-Kano Standard Gauge Railway.   
 #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: .@FMPWH is one of the drivers of this Government’s commitment to renew and increase Nigeria’s stock of infrastructure in order to achieve global economic competitiveness as targeted under the Economic Recovery and Growth Plan. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We are going to make significant in-roads in advancing road, rail and power projects across the country. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
My address to fellow Nigerians this morning is devoted mainly to informing you about the intense efforts this Administration is putting to address our country's huge infrastructural deficit.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: We must change our way of doing things or we will stagnate and be left behind in the race to lift our people out of poverty and into prosperity. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Such unpatriotism will not divert the Administration from the course we have set ourselves. Our government's watch word and policy thrust is CHANGE. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
I am determined to get to the root of this collective blackmail of all Nigerians and ensure that whichever groups are behind this manipulated hardship will be prevented from doing so again.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: The consequence was that not many could travel and the few who did had to pay exorbitant transport fares. This is unacceptable given that NNPC had taken measures to ensure availability at all depots. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
Instead of showing love, companionship and charity, some of our compatriots chose this period to inflict severe hardship on us all by creating unnecessary fuel scarcity across the country.
#PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Unfortunately, I am saddened to acknowledge that for many this Christmas and New Year holidays have been anything but merry and happy. #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text:
I join my fellow citizens this morning to welcome and celebrate the New Year 2018. This year promises to be pivotal in our quest for CHANGE. 
 #PMBNewYearSpeech
author: MBuhari

text: Happy New Year to all Nigerians. You can read the text of my New Year's Address here: https://statehouse.gov.ng/news/new-year-address-by-president-buhari-jan-1-2018/ …
author: MBuhari

text:
I am deeply convinced that better days lie ahead for us as a nation as we make progress on all the major fronts where we have set our energies to surmount the challenges. 

And in this season of hope, let us remember to provide refuge and help to those less privileged than us.
author: MBuhari

text: I wish all Nigerians Happy Christmas celebrations. As I noted yesterday, the fuel scarcity that has caused many of you to spend this period on fuel queues is deeply regretted. All relevant agencies of Government are working round-the-clock to bring relief to you.
author: MBuhari

text:
I have also directed the regulators to step up their surveillance and bring an end to hoarding and price inflation by marketers.

Let me also assure that the relevant agencies will continue to provide updates on the situation. I thank you all for your patience and understanding.
author: MBuhari

text: I have the NNPC's assurance that the situation will improve significantly over the next few days, as new shipments and supplies are distributed across the country.
author: MBuhari

text: The fuel scarcity being experienced nationwide is regrettable. I sympathize with all Nigerians,on having to endure needless fuel queues. I'm being regularly briefed, especially on the NNPC's interventions to ensure that there is enough petrol available during this period & beyond
author: MBuhari

text: The national leadership of the Nigerian Bar Association (NBA) visited today. I assured them of our commitment to the Rule of Law and due process, and made it clear that we expect a corresponding duty on their part to ensure the highest forms of discipline among their members.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I signed the Condolence Register for the late former Vice President, Alex Ekwueme. We lost a great man, a statesman totally committed to the unity of Nigeria. The story of Nigeria's democracy would be incomplete without him. May his soul Rest In Peace.
author: MBuhari

text: Happy 55th birthday to @bukolasaraki. I join members of the National Assembly, friends and family in celebrating a distinguished Nigerian who has made his mark on the political scene. May God grant him more years of good health, wisdom and fulfillment in the service of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: I'm spending a few days at home in Daura before I travel to France for the One Planet Summit. Today I paid a visit to my farm. I grow fruits & vegetables,& keep cattle. I hope this will inspire one more person to take up farming. My vision is for a country that grows what it eats
author: MBuhari

text: Before I concluded my Visit to Kano State I commissioned two factories: the Gerawa Oil Mills Limited, and the Fullmark Rice Mills. Both are fully indigenous companies, and testament to the success of our efforts at creating an enabling environment for investment in Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: As I've repeatedly said, the only way I can repay Nigeria and Nigerians for their faith in me, is to completely dedicate myself to serving you. I will not let you down. I will continue to belong to everybody and belong to nobody, as I promised in my Inauguration address.
author: MBuhari

text: I'm grateful for the very enthusiastic welcome I've received in Kano. As I said at the dinner reception for me last night,I think it has also sent a clear message to the opposition. I'm deeply & eternally grateful to God & the people of Kano for the complete trust they have in me
author: MBuhari

text: Regarding corruption,when I was a military HoS, we locked every suspect in Kirikiri prisons until they proved they were not guilty. Now things are different. The constitution guarantees that everyone is innocent until proven guilty.That is the constitution, & we will abide by it!
author: MBuhari

text: This morning I met with religious leaders in Kano. We discussed issues relating to law enforcement, the fight against corruption, and the growing problem of drug abuse in Nigeria, especially among our youth. We will go after those who sell and distribute these illicit substances.
author: MBuhari

text: My condolences to the families of the victims of the bomb attacks in Biu yesterday. I'm confident that the Intelligence Fusion Center we're setting up in Maiduguri will help us stay ahead of Boko Haram's desperate attacks on soft targets. May the souls of the dead rest in peace.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I held a Bilateral Meeting with King Abdullah II of Jordan. We agreed that more than ever the world requires cooperation and information sharing to defeat terrorism and extremism. I also thanked the King for Jordan's consistent security support to Nigeria. #PMBinJordan
author: MBuhari

text: Also met with Chancellor Merkel yesterday, in Abidjan. We discussed increased cooperation to check the illegal migration of Nigerians to Europe. We also discussed the progress of our war on terrorism, as well as investment opportunities in Nigeria for German companies.
author: MBuhari

text: I met with President Ouattara on the sidelines of the AU-EU Summit. An opportunity for frank talk about the situation in Togo. We must find a solution. The government and opposition must work to gain each other's trust. Instability in Togo will have serious regional consequences.
author: MBuhari

text: We have also started bringing back home all Nigerians stranded in Libya and elsewhere. We will ensure they all return home safely and are rehabilitated.
author: MBuhari

text: The situation in Libya, of people being sold into slavery, is appalling and unacceptable. We will do everything to protect our citizens wherever they might be.
author: MBuhari

text: I shared with His Royal Majesty the strong relationship I maintained with his predecessor and father, who was a Federal Permanent Secretary in the 1970s. The late Oba Erediauwa I was a backbone of support for me when I was Federal Commissioner for Petroleum Resources.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I received the Oba of Benin, His Royal Majesty, Omo N’Oba Uku Akpolokpolo, Oba Ewuare II. I have great respect and admiration for the Eweka Dynasty of Benin Kingdom. From the colonial era till now they have consistently played a stabilizing role in the affairs of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: Saddened by the very cruel and dastardly suicide bombing attack in a mosque in Mubi, earlier today. My condolences to the families of the victims, and the government and people of Adamawa State. May the souls of the dead rest in peace.
author: MBuhari

text: I wish Governor Obiano a successful second term in office, and assure him that the Federal Government under my watch will continue to work with him for the peace, progress and development of Anambra State.
author: MBuhari

text: The peaceful conduct and outcome of the Anambra election is an important step in the right direction, as we continue our electoral reform efforts. I am determined to give Nigeria free and fair elections, no matter which way the results swing.
author: MBuhari

text: I congratulate Governor @WillieMObiano on his re-election. Let me also commend the people of Anambra State, the candidates, @inecnigeria, security agencies and all other stakeholders, on the peaceful conduct of Saturday's election.
author: MBuhari

text: Today in Abuja I declared open the 2017 All Nigeria Judges Conference. We will continue to respect the Constitutional rights of the Judiciary, and expect its full support and collaboration in our fight against Corruption.
author: MBuhari

text: On behalf of the Federal Executive Council, and all Nigerians, I wish former President @GEJonathan a happy 60th birthday, today. I pray that the Almighty God will continue to bless him with good health, wisdom and strength.
author: MBuhari

text: My condolences go to his family, friends, the Government and people of Anambra State, Ndigbo, and to the entire nation. May God grant his family the fortitude to bear this loss.
author: MBuhari

text: Dr. Ekwueme lived a worthy life, excelled in professional practice, in business, in politics, in philanthropy. He served Nigeria and humanity. We will miss his counsel and wisdom on national issues. May his soul rest in peace.
author: MBuhari

text: I mourn the death of former Vice President, Dr. Alex Ekwueme, a patriot and statesman. His life was marked by an unwavering commitment to the unity and progress of Nigeria; and his personal sacrifices helped lay the foundation for our democracy.
author: MBuhari

text: I will continue to express my gratitude to all Nigerians for your kindness and support during my medical vacation. The only way I can repay you is to rededicate myself to working to protect your interests and to build the Nigeria of our dreams. #ANewNigeria #Change
author: MBuhari

text: Congratulations to our soaring Super Eagles, and to all Nigerians, on tonight's victory against Argentina.
author: MBuhari

text: Let me specially commend Governor David Umahi for his vision and commitment to the development of Ebonyi State. We are united by our unwavering commitment towards ensuring that the lives of our people are made better by our service.
author: MBuhari

text: Let me make this clear: We will deliver on all our promises to you. I said it when I met with Southeast leaders last month in Abuja, in response to the issues they raised about the state of roads and infrastructure in the region. I'm saying it again: We will not let you down.
author: MBuhari

text: The welcome also came with 2 Chieftaincy titles: Enyioma 1 of Ebonyi, which I am told means Trustworthy friend of Ebonyi; & Ochioha Ndigbo, which means Leader of Igbo people. I am a strong believer in the unity of Nigeria. Our diversity should be a source of strength not weakness
author: MBuhari

text: I thank the people of the Southeast for the enthusiastic welcome they've accorded me since I arrived this morning. From Enugu to Abakaliki, I have enjoyed a profuse display of warmth from everyone; political leaders, traditional leaders, citizens. I thank you all.
author: MBuhari

text: I touched on the situation in Kaduna, where Gov @elrufai is trying to implement important reforms. It's a very serious situation when teachers cannot pass the exams they're supposed to administer to their students. It underscores the urgent need for comprehensive national reform.
author: MBuhari

text: I just opened a Special Retreat of the Federal Executive Council on the challenges facing Nigeria's education sector. We've brought together Government officials, academic experts, civil society and development institutions for this all-important conversation.
author: MBuhari

text: The CAN delegation raised concerns about the allegations of one-sidedness in federal appointments. I assured them that we will look at it. I have already instructed that a list of all heads of parastatals be submitted to me. We will ensure that we treat all Nigerians equitably.
author: MBuhari

text: Following the meeting with Christian leaders, led by the President of the Christian Association of Nigeria, Rev Ayokunle, I met with a delegation of Muslim leaders, led by the Secretary General of Jama'atu Nasril Islam (JNI), Dr. Khalid Abubakar Aliyu.
author: MBuhari

text: I just welcomed Christian leaders to the State House, for a meeting. At 2pm I will meet with Muslim leaders. Our diversity is one of the most important things about us as a nation, and we must do everything in our power to promote religious harmony and understanding.
author: MBuhari

text:
Doing More With Less; Keeping the Promise of Change. @nsia_nigeria has seen inflows of $500m under the @MBuhari Administration 
#GovtAtWorkNG #MoreWithLess
author: MBuhari

text:
15/ Our SWF did not receive new investment for 4 years of record high oil prices.
But despite low prices, we invested an additional US$500m.
author: MBuhari

text: 14/ A new non-stop express Train service(1 hour 15min) between Abuja & Kaduna will launch by December 2017,to complement existing services
author: MBuhari

text: 13/ We've commenced extension of the Lagos-Ibadan Standard Gauge Rail Line to connect Apapa & Tin Can Port Complexes. Completion by Dec 2018
author: MBuhari

text: 12/ We have approved a N701bn Payment Guarantee Scheme that will assure GenCos of up to 80% payment on invoices, & restore sector confidence
author: MBuhari

text: 11/ Since 2015 the TCN and NDPHC have invested and worked to expand Transmission capacity, so that today it can handle up to 7,000MW.
author: MBuhari

text: 10/ We're introducing innovative financing to bridge infrastructure gaps. Like private sector road interventions in exchange for tax credits
author: MBuhari

text: 9/ In addition we have also been adjudged one of the world's Top 10 Reformers by the standards of the World Bank Doing Business Index.
author: MBuhari

text: 8/ Our target for this year's World Bank Doing Business Index was to move 20 places up. We moved 24. I commend VP @ProfOsinbajo and PEBEC.
author: MBuhari

text: 7/ 2008 Nigeria was ranked 120th on World Bank's Doing Biz Index. By 2015 when we took office,we'd fallen to 169. In 2017 we're up 24 places
author: MBuhari

text: 6/ In the 2016 Budget we invested 1.2 Trillion Naira in infrastructure. This is the highest ever in Nigeria's history. We will do even more.
author: MBuhari

text: 5/ Our Social Investment Prog is feeding 4.5m Schoolchildren; employed 200,000 unemployed graduates; & disbursed loans to 250,000 businesses
author: MBuhari

text: 4/ We've kick-started the abandoned Itakpe-Ajaokuta-Warri Rail Line, unfinished for over 17 years. We expect to commission it by Sept 2018.
author: MBuhari

text: 3/ The Bonny-Bodo Road, conceived decades ago and then abandoned, is now back on course, jointly funded by the FGN and Nigeria LNG Limited
author: MBuhari

text: 2/ All of the 100 billion Naira we raised from our recent Sukuk financing is going into the development of 25 key roads across Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: 1/ Abuja Metro Rail, only 50% completed as at 2015 when we took office—after 8 years. I'm proud to say we've now taken it to 98% completion.
author: MBuhari

text: I will leave with you a few highlights from my speech today. Some of the evidence of the CHANGE we promised and continue to speak about.
author: MBuhari

text:
2 points I'd like to reiterate:
1. The quickest solutions not always the best
2. Only Nigerian solutions can fix Nigeria's unique problems
author: MBuhari

text: I will never tire of repeating this: a new era is here, the old Nigeria is surely disappearing. We must work together to sustain this CHANGE
author: MBuhari

text: I thank you for your support and goodwill. As we emerge from a very difficult economic period, I'm confident that a new Nigeria beckons.
author: MBuhari

text: Let me reassure all Nigerians of our determination to bring succour to you, to improve your lives, and deliver on our promises to you.
author: MBuhari

text: I appeal to the National Assembly to swiftly consider & pass the 2018 Appropriation Bill.Let us work together to strengthen our relationship
author: MBuhari

text: I cannot but commend the patriotism & collaboration of the National Assembly, in our collective effort to move Nigeria forward. I thank you.
author: MBuhari

text: This afternoon I presented the 2018 Budget Proposal to a joint session of the National Assembly.
author: MBuhari

text: I'm deeply grieved to learn of the passing of Jide Tinubu. My deepest condolences to the Tinubu family on this sad and painful loss.
author: MBuhari

text: I look forward to even greater achievements that will make a difference in the lives of all Nigerians. We will not let you down.
author: MBuhari

text: I particularly commend PEBEC, chaired by Vice President @ProfOsinbajo, for this job well done in improving Nigeria's business environment.
author: MBuhari

text: We also want foreign business visitors to obtain their visas on arrival; & pass through our airports & do their businesses with ease & speed
author: MBuhari

text: We want our people to be able to register their businesses speedily; access land & credit & obtain licenses without bureaucratic bottlenecks
author: MBuhari

text: Our goal is to make it easy for people - Nigerians and foreigners alike - to invest and do business in Nigeria. I'm pleased by this progress
author: MBuhari

text: I also congratulate all Stakeholders: the Presidential Enabling Business Environment Council (PEBEC), the National Assembly, & State Govts.
author: MBuhari

text: I congratulate all Nigerians on this landmark achievement, which symbolizes the success of our Ease of Doing Business Reforms.
author: MBuhari

text: The news that Nigeria moved 24 places up in the World Bank Doing Business rankings released today is most welcome. I'm very pleased by it.
author: MBuhari

text: Our Change, the Change that the APC represents, is here to stay. We will stay united as a Party & continue to work for the good of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: We will expand the Federal Executive Council to bring in more people and fresh ideas, for the ultimate benefit of the people of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: Regarding concerns about the representation of our supporters in the Federal Government, rest assured that this is also being looked into.
author: MBuhari

text: I know that our supporters are also very eager for these Board appointments to be announced. By God's grace they will be announced soon.
author: MBuhari

text: I said last year that we would shortly reconstitute the Boards of Parastatals. I regret the fact that we've not done so, for many reasons.
author: MBuhari

text: Nevertheless, we will not rest on these achievements. There are still quite a number of challenges before us, and we are well aware of these
author: MBuhari

text: Today,the World Bank released its latest Business Rankings report. We moved up 24 places,& are one of the world's 10 most improved countries
author: MBuhari

text: Internationally, Nigeria's prestige and credit-worthiness have gone up. We have regained our respect on the International stage.
author: MBuhari

text: We've seen regular supply of petroleum products, a successful Presidential Fertilizer Initiative; & TSA Implementation. This change is real.
author: MBuhari

text: The APC is proud of our achievements in the last 2 years: the fight against Boko Haram, Agric Revolution, Improved Power, Peace in the Delta
author: MBuhari

text: I must therefore thank all stakeholders, as well as a number of non-APC members who have consistently risen above petty partisan interests.
author: MBuhari

text: I am aware that it is sometimes easier to manage failure than to manage success—especially the kind of big success the APC achieved in 2015.
author: MBuhari

text: I have a long list of people I would like to thank: our Party leadership, the leadership of the National Assembly, our State Governors.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I attended a Meeting of the National Executive Committee of our party, the All Progressives Congress.
author: MBuhari

text: That said, the integration agenda is a welcome one, & Nigeria will surely play a leading role—as long as all concerns are properly addressed
author: MBuhari

text: Nigeria's recommendation is for the constitution of an expert committee to come up with an acceptable Roadmap, and timelines and budget.
author: MBuhari

text: We must not lower the criteria or be in a hurry simply because we want to achieve a monetary union.  There is still a lot of work to be done
author: MBuhari

text: Our view is that ECOWAS member states are not yet fully prepared for a monetary union.This has always been one of Nigeria's primary concerns
author: MBuhari

text: Nigeria will caution against any position that pushes for a fast-track approach to monetary union, while neglecting pertinent issues.
author: MBuhari

text: Regarding integration, it is important to take into consideration our varying economic conditions,as well as the lessons unfolding in the EU
author: MBuhari

text: Today in Niamey I urged ECOWAS countries to proceed with caution regarding the push for a single regional currency by 2020.
author: MBuhari

text: There is no one who doesn't see that there's been a considerable improvement of security in the N/East. But we will not let down our guard.
author: MBuhari

text: I highlighted our success in moving Boko Haram out from their strongholds. Even their attacks on soft targets are becoming less frequent.
author: MBuhari

text: Our discussion also touched on the fight against terrorism, where we have recorded significant progress.
author: MBuhari

text: I told PM Abbasi that Pakistan should take full advantage of the new investment climate in Nigeria—product of our @EBESnigeria reforms.
author: MBuhari

text: The performance of our countries in relation to trade and industrial cooperation has however been very disappointing. We need to do more.
author: MBuhari

text: My bilateral meeting with Pakistani PM Shahid Khakan Abbasi was fruitful. We have a long history of defence and military cooperation.
author: MBuhari

text: On behalf of the government and people of Nigeria, I congratulate @akin_adesina and the @AfDB_Group family on the #WorldFoodPrize honour.
author: MBuhari

text: I appeal to the communities in the region to continue to strive for peace through dialogue, to achieve conflict resolution.
author: MBuhari

text: Our New Vision for the Niger Delta will ensure that the people of the region benefit from and enjoy the wealth of their land. #NDNewVision
author: MBuhari

text: This is yet another demonstration of our commitment to fully deliver our New Vision for the Niger Delta #NDNewVision
author: MBuhari

text: Today I signed into law a bill establishing the University of Petroleum Resources, Effurun, Delta State. #NDNewVision
author: MBuhari

text: When our children thrive, Nigeria thrives. We have a duty & responsibility to deliver a better Nigeria to them,and we will not let them down
author: MBuhari

text: You may know 3-year-old Maya Jammal, from her 'Baba Buhari' videos. Today it was my pleasure to meet her, Nicole Benson & Aisha Aliyu Gebbi
author: MBuhari

text: Let me also use this opportunity to express my satisfaction with the mutually beneficial cooperation between Nigeria and China.
author: MBuhari

text: It is my firm belief that the CPC's 19th National Congress will usher in a new period of great accomplishment for the Party and for China.
author: MBuhari

text: On behalf of the Govt & people of Nigeria, I congratulate the Communist Party of China on the occasion of their 19th National Congress.
author: MBuhari

text: We will work honestly and faithfully with every region of Nigeria, for the good of all. We will not let anyone down.
author: MBuhari

text: I want the Southeast to rest assured that we will deliver all the critical infrastructure projects we promised.
author: MBuhari

text: I thank the delegation for articulating their demands, and I promise that my administration will continue to serve every part of Nigeria.
author: MBuhari

text: Let me again assure that we are committed to the delivery of these infrastructure projects, with funding support from China.
author: MBuhari

text: Projects like the 2nd Niger Bridge, East-West Road & Coastal Rail project, which will positively impact the Southeast, are a priority for us
author: MBuhari

text: This afternoon I welcomed a delegation of South East leaders, led by Dep Senate President Ike Ekweremadu, to a meeting at the State House.
author: MBuhari

text: I pray that the Almighty God will comfort their families and friends. My deepest sympathies go to the Government and people of Kaduna State.
author: MBuhari

text: I am deeply saddened by the news of the tragic drowning of students of Victory College, Kaduna, while on an excursion.
author: MBuhari

text: Our party's Governorship candidate in Anambra State, Hon Tony Nwoye, paid me a visit today at the State House.
author: MBuhari

text: We are pleased with the progress so far in the implementation of our Agric vision for Nigeria, but we will not rest on our oars.
author: MBuhari

text: Briefing today, from the Security Chiefs. The Armed Forces & other security agencies have our full support towards ensuring peace & security
author: MBuhari

text: The perseverance, resilience, discipline, hard work and team-spirit which has propelled the Eagles to excel is worthy of emulation by all.
author: MBuhari

text: The Federal Government is grateful to the Government of Akwa Ibom for the invaluable support it has been rendering to the Super Eagles.
author: MBuhari

text: Tonight the Super Eagles gave us  a 57th Independence Anniversary gift. I join millions of Nigerians in rejoicing with the players and crew.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I received Governor Obiano at the State House. The Federal & State Govts will work together to ensure free & fair elections next month
author: MBuhari

text: In Maiduguri I also visited our heroes wounded in the line of duty. Nigeria will eternally be grateful for their sacrifice.
author: MBuhari

text: Today I visited the Headquarters of Operation Lafiya Dole in Maiduguri, Borno State, to spend time with our troops.
author: MBuhari

text: The 1st of October is a day for celebration; for thanksgiving, reflection, re-dedication. God bless our dear Nigeria https://www.facebook.com/MuhammaduBuhari/posts/2021767871436736 …
author: MBuhari

text: She has won a well-deserved oppportunity to continue the strong leadership she has shown in domestic and International matters.
author: MBuhari

text: I congratulate Chancellor Merkel on her electoral victory, and wish her a successful tenure ahead.
author: MBuhari

text: We discussed, among other things, America's ongoing support for Nigeria's fight against Terrorism and Corruption.
author: MBuhari

text: This afternoon I joined a number of fellow African Heads of State at a Lunch hosted by President @realDonaldTrump.
author: MBuhari
